cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.LO, cs.DM, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the complexity of Boolean circuits, which is a fundamental topic in theoretical computer science. The concept of inversion complexity is closely related to circuit complexity and is a well-studied area in the field. Therefore, cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the study of monotone and non-monotone functions, which are important topics in discrete mathematics and combinatorics, respectively. Hence, cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also involves the use of logarithmic functions, which is a common tool in information theory, and hence cs.IT (Information Theory) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the study of chains of tuples of variable values, which is a topic in data structures and algorithms, and hence cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) are also possible sub-categories.
